Company Profile:
Wing Bank (Cambodia) Plc – the bank for every Cambodian – is driven by the vision to provide every Cambodian with convenient access to financial services relevant to, and for the improvement of their daily lives.

Wing Bank has revolutionized the way Cambodians access financial services by introducing instant, secure, and convenient Mobile Financial Services since 18 August 2008.

Today, Wing Bank serves the entire Cambodian population with 100% coverage of the districts in Cambodia thanks to the innovative Wing Bank App, over 10,000 Wing Cash Xpress agents, over 55,000 merchants, and partnerships with industry giants such as Mastercard, MoneyGram, AliPay, WeChat Pay, Western Union, Visa, and Ria.

Wing Bank provides an array of advanced financial products both for individual and corporate customers. These include loans, deposits, micro savings, credit referral services, money transfers, utility and insurance payments, supply chain payments, payroll services and even phone top-ups. In addition, Wing offers retail payments via “WingPay”, and has also introduced the “WingMall” e-commerce platform.

Both small and large companies alike are now using Wing’s payroll and disbursement services, speeding up their payments. Over 80% of Wing’s agents and 50% of customers are women, making Wing a shining example of gender inclusion in the region.

Wing Bank is committed to providing financial, gender and digital inclusion to the unbanked and the under-banked, allowing every Cambodian to enjoy convenience and security when it comes to financial services

job title: Head of Marketing and Social Performance
position: Head of Marketing and Social Performance
Company Profile:
1. VISION:
“A leading Cambodian social microfinance institution working to achieve positive and lasting changes in the livelihoods of economically active poor families in a socially responsible manner”

2. MISSION:
“To improve the livelihoods, skills, and self-confidence of poor families in Cambodia by providing responsible microfinance and complementary socio-economic services”

3. CORE VALUES:
■ INTEGRITY: 
Chamroeun provides financial services and socio-economic services to its clients to enhance their well-being. It achieves this ethically and with transparent, fair, and cost effective methods. This manner is also applied to Chamroeun’s other stakeholders.

■ QUALITY OF SERVICES: 
At Chamroeun, we believe that our clients deserve tailored as well as efficient services. We provide these services in a convenient, proactive, and timely manner.

■ TRANSPARENCY: 
At Chamroeun, we provide our clients and other stakeholders with complete and accurate information about the terms and conditions of our products and services. Information is provided in a user-friendly manner to enable them to easily understand those terms and conditions.

■ FAIR PRACTICES: 
At Chamroeun, we ensure that the services we provide to our clients as well as the interactions we have with other stakeholders are not unethical or deceptive. We are committed to building relationships that are based on respect, fair treatments, and courtesy.

■ CONFIDENTIALITY: 
Privacy of our clients and other stakeholders is strictly safeguarded and stored, and such data is only used upon their consents, and they are well informed on specific purposes of data usage.

■ NON-DISCRIMINATION: 
Chamroeun considers its clients and other stakeholders as value assets and take all of efforts to make sure that the institution treats them in appropriate manner.

Job Description:
Job Purpose:
Senior Supervisor, Public Affairs, acts as a company’s ‘conscience’, championing and developing the ethical, environmentally-friendly, and community-minded side of a business. The job involves creating links between a business and the community, raising positive awareness of the organisation's commitment to sustainable social responsibility.

Main Responsibilities:
•	Assisting the company in defining, developing, implementing and monitoring strategic CSR activities;
•	Using internal communication to reinforce the company’s CSR knowledge to all staff
•	Reaching out to the public via PR and marketing to deliver the message of the company’s commitment to social responsibility
Job Requirement:
	Bachelor’s degree
	Minimum 3 years of relevant experience in CSR or Public Relations or equivalent experience.
	Strong collaboration and networking skills
	Good command in English, computer skill such Word, PowerPoint
	Being good at listening skills, teamwork and demonstrates intellectual curiosity.
Company Profile:
Prudential (Cambodia) Life Assurance PLC began operations in Cambodia in January 2013. It is the leading life insurer in Cambodia with more than USD280 million assured and 27,000 policies issued (as at 31 September 2015). One of the first life insurers in Cambodia, Prudential Cambodia is committed to raising the awareness of life insurance among the Cambodian people and helping them protect and secure their financial futures.

Prudential Cambodia is part of UK-based Prudential plc. Founded in 1848, Prudential plc is an international financial services group with significant operations in Asia, the US and the UK. It serves around 25 million insurance customers and have £505 billion of assets under management (as at 30 June 2015). Prudential plc is listed on the stock exchanges in London, Hong Kong, Singapore and New York.

Prudential plc is not affiliated in any manner with Prudential Financial, Inc., a company whose principal place of business is in the United States of America.
Contact Info: Contact Information PCLA Recruitment HR Manager 087333908 pclarecruitment@prudential.com.kh Phnom Penh Tower, 20F, #445 Monivong Blvd, Boeung Prolit, 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 087333908

Company Profile:
Created with sustainability in mind, Song Saa Private Island reflects the beauty of the Cambodian coastline. It’s a place that breathes in time with nature, built from local materials, by local hands, and infused with local art and soul. An evolved tropical getaway with a pristine private beach, spacious wooden villas, heavenly spa sanctuaries and a preserved coral reef, Song Saa Private Island lets you detach from the world and tune into simple luxuries.

Built with reclaimed timber and materials from the mainland, the resort’s design and architecture reiterates our commitment to sustainability. Each villa is a private sanctuary, a refined blend of thatched roofs, linen-draped canopy beds, up-cycled décor and repurposed furniture. Discarded oil drums find new life as lamps. Driftwood serves as a table or bench. Salvaged wood from old fishing boats and factory yards now forms decks and floors and beams.

company_name: Kim Mex Construction & Investment Co., Ltd
Job Description:
• Minimize the exposure to safety-related risks of KM personnel and its Subcontractors
• Inspect, evaluate, and analyses work environments, equipment and practices from a safety at work standpoint
• Monitor and record list of hazard material on site (file all MSDS – Material Safety Data Sheet – as required)
• Recommend measures to control, eliminate, and prevent disease or injury caused by chemical, physical, and biological agents or ergonomic factors and help protect workers from potentially hazardous work methods, processes, or materials. Investigate health-related complaints
• Check pollution and housekeeping
• Ensure compliance with safety standards and government regulations on the health and safety of individuals and monitor introduction of new laws
• Organize and monitor safety training and education programs, in liaison with training centers and facilitators
• Investigate and report on all incidents and near misses that occur on site. Assist injured parties, and department heads to complete incident forms
• Prepare statistics for the project
• Check and ensure all workers and staff wear the proper PPE (Personal Protective Equipment)
Job Requirement:
• Education: Bachelor Degree or equivalent
• At least 3 years work experience in Safety preferably in construction field
• Good command of Khmer and English, both spoken and written (must be able to write reports)
• Computer fluency in Word, Excel and PowerPoint
• Good inter-personal skills, must be able to communicate well with staff and governmental institutions
• Must be able to prepare and deliver simple training and presentation material
• Strong team player, working effectively with all staff members at all levels
• Global mindset, pro-active, analytical, problem-solving, paired with a very clear hands-on mentality

DFI Lucky Private Limited is a member of Dairy Farm International Group, one of the region’s most respected retailers, currently running 6,500 outlets and over 180,000 employees. Job Description:
Main Responsibilities:

1.	Sale Distributions
-Design, build and manage multi-channel distribution, direct marketing, and claim and call center.
-Provide leadership on sale strategies to sale team.
-Drive strategy, planning and execution of new business initiatives, including differentiated products, services and customer segmentation to leverage sale volume.
-Support in prepare, consolidate, and reviews the business plan of micro-insurance.
-Accountable for achieving defined target objectives in respect of sales and profit, cost and operational efficiency, market penetration, and business growth to be align with company’s business direction.
-Closely monitor the actual achievement compared to business plan and provide support to sale team to achieve sale targets.
-Act as lead client-care officer through direct contract with every client and partner.
Define and implement measurement strategies that align with client marketing and business objectives.
-Collect/ update and analyze required information relating to competitors, and clients’ feedbacks/ concerns using competition matrices, future trends, and client’s satisfaction surveys on a regular basis in order to update sale and distribution strategies and to overcome impact the business.
-Develop effective promotion and client retention strategy to stay competitive in the field.

2.	Product Development 

-Provide leadership on the micro-insurance product development including conducting market research, insurance product development, conducting actuary study, and setting the premium charge.
-Develop micro-insurance operations policies.
-Regularly analyze the insurance premium collected compared to claims and recommend change on insurance policies.
-Train and support to field offices related to micro-insurance products as needed.

3.	Operations Management

-Planning, implementing, managing and controlling all operational activities of the company, with the aim of achieving and sustaining operational excellence.
-Conduct regular or spot check monitoring visits to fields to ensure that field resources are properly managed and operating systems including policies and procedures are followed.
-Hires, and manages human resources and promotes a culture that reflects the organization’s values and encourages strong performance.
-Produce operational and analytical report to monitor the progress of actual performance against plan. 
-Performs any other duties as assigned by CEO.
Job Requirement:
Qualifications and Requirements:

-BA/MBA in Accounting, Banking/Finance, Business Management or related disciplines.
-At least five-year experience in leading insurance sale operations and product development.
-Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills.
-Proven track record of motivating and developing capable management teams.
-Good working knowledge of computer software.
-Strong written and oral communication skills in both English and Khmer.
-Excellent financial, analytical, organizational, and problem solving skills; and

job title: Head of Finance and Administration Department (01 post)
position: Head of Finance and Administration Department (01 post)
Job Description:
-Provide overall management on finance team to ensure accurate accounting records and insurance standards.
-Analyze company’s profits and loss and analyze key ratios and advise management for any variation.
-Manage company’s cash flow.
-Ensure financial report are produced accurately, on time, and compliance with regulatory financial reporting requirements.
-Ensure the compliance of financial accounting standards.
-Adjust reserves and provide reserve recommendations to ensure reserving activities consistent with company’s policies.
-Conduct detailed bill reviews to implement sound litigation management and expense control.
-Analyze and classify risks and investments to determine their potential impacts on companies.
-Develop and analyze information to assess the current and future financial status of the company.
-Establish procedures for custody and control of assets and records in order to ensure safekeeping.
-Evaluate data pertaining to costs in order to plan budgets.
-Evaluate financial reporting systems, accounting and collection procedures, and investment activities, and make recommendations for changes to procedures, operating systems, budgets, and other financial control functions.
-Prepare operational and risk reports for management analysis.
-Review collection reports to determine the status of collections and the amounts of outstanding balances.  
-Oversight company administration and procurement 
-Manage human resource & labor compliance
-Manage staff monthly payroll
-Declare tax to be incompliance with applicable taxation law
-Recruit staff members, motivate, and build staff capacity.
-Performs any other duties as assigned by CEO.
Job Requirement:
Qualifications and Requirements:

•BA/MBA in Accounting/Finance and Banking.
•At least five-year experience in financial management. Experience in insurance industry is an advantage.
•Good knowledge of microinsurance accounting standard.
•Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills.
•Good working knowledge of computer software.
•Strong written and oral communication skills in both English and Khmer.
•Excellent financial, analytical, organizational, and problem solving skills.

* Location: Head Office	
* Deadline: Feb 04,2021




How to Apply For:
Interested candidates, please submit your Cover Letter, CV and relevant documents to the Head Office of Serendip Microinsurance PLC. at #101A, St. 289, Phum 1, Boeng Kak Ti Muoy, Tuol Kork, Phnom Penh or via email: recruitment@lolc.com.kh

Job Description:
The customer is the focus of everything we do, and millions of end users rely on our products daily. We believe in the value of empowering Intern, Agency Administration with the resources to solve critical problems for the future of our business, which is why we need you. 

Intern, Agency Administration duties and responsibilities include providing administrative support to ensure efficiency and effectiveness in Agency Admin Operation. 

What motivates you? 
• You obsess about customers, listen, engage and act for their benefit 
• You think big, with curiosity to discover ways to use your agile mindset and enable business outcomes 
• You thrive in teams, and enjoy getting things done together
• You take ownership and build solutions, focusing on what matters 
• You do what is right, work with integrity and speak up
• You share your humanity, helping us build a diverse and inclusive work environment for everyone

On the job you will: 
• Perform Insurance Advisor terminated/ Reinstatement Prepare name list of terminated and reinstated IA and send to relative department Create AWS code for join new sale staff and send to relative department Support administrative task.
• New join Insurance Advisor conversion, Register wing account of Insurance Advisor/ Sale Staff
• Prepare name list of new join Insurance Advisor and send to relative department in order to upload their thumbprint
• Consolidate Insurance Advisor terminated and reinstatement form at the end of the month
• Perform policy assign servicing for both Agency and Partnership channel

 Our commitment to you 
• Our mission; to be a part of making Decisions Easier and Lives Better
• A leadership team dedicated to your growth and success 
• A bold ambition and set of goals to be a leader in driving transformation in our industry 
• Our best. Every day. 
• We are committed to be an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age”.
Job Requirement:
We are looking for someone with: 
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills 
• Excellent analytical, problem solving and solutioning skills 
• A capacity for constant learning from both success and failure 
• Open to change and continuous improvement

Nice to Haves:  
• University Student (3rd-4th year) in Accounting, Finance or related field is preferred
• Teamwork, focused, results driven, professional maturity, and self-confidence
• Work efficiently and accurately and able to work under pressure and independently, a team player who is self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision
• Have a strong character and able to consider and advice on the consequences of various courses of action
• Detail oriented with patience on detail paper works and record setup in system

Company Profile: Manulife is a leading Canada-based financial services group with principal operations in Asia, Canada and the United States. Clients look to Manulife for strong, reliable, trustworthy and forward-thinking solutions for their most significant financial decisions. Our international network of employees, agents and distribution partners offers financial protection and wealth management products and services to millions of clients. We also provide asset management services to institutional customers. At the end of June 2016, we had US$718 billion in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made more than US25.4 billion in benefits, interest and other payments to our customers. Our group of companies operates as Manulife in Canada and Asia and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as 'MFC' on the TSX, NYSE and PSE, and under '945' on the SEHK. We are committed to be an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age”.

Job Description:

Company Profile: Since its founding in 1982, Chip Mong has focused extensively on the changing needs of the society and the strengthening of its relationships with business communities, both domestically and internationally. Job Description:
I.	PURPOSE OF THE JOB
•	Manage Show Room after sales service 
•	Manage team services to settle problem on time and efficiency 
•	Support dealers in term of sales expect

II.	MAIN DUTIES
•	Oversee operations in 3W/2W service unit to ensure compliance with quality
Standards
•	Oversee the inspection of all vehicle and fix faulty components a long with facilitation of  process for repairs
•	Supervise the activities of automotive service technicians to ensure efficient job performance and timely repairs
•	Oversee the hiring and training of an effective service team
•	Monitor inventory to regulate and ensure availability of required vehicle parts
•	Evaluate the performance of automotive service staff in order to acknowledge efficient employees and guide under performing ones
•	Listen to client complaints and assist in addressing their issues and resolving challenges
•	Assign and schedule work duties to vehicle service staff according to their mechanics skills ensure complete customer satisfaction
•	Responsible for part warranty and claim.
•	Oversea and improving the warranty policy or service policy.
•	Manage all equipment for service
•	Do as leader and staff management.
•	Other task assigned by superior
Job Requirement:
•	Must have a bachelor’s degree mechanic, or relevant fields.
•	Minimum 5 years experiences in automotive industry
•	Experiences in automobile after sale services related.
•	Able to use English as well
•	Passionate about automobile and assembly.
•	Good communication skills as well.
•	Computer, Ms. Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Internet & email
•	Analyze and come up with solutions when repairing and maintaining vehicles.
•	Can open to travel to support all dealers 
•	Can able to manage the team of mechanics and advisors (team experience is mandatory)
•	Can train new mechanics

Company Profile:
Prudential (Cambodia) Life Assurance PLC began operations in Cambodia in January 2013. It is the leading life insurer in Cambodia with more than USD280 million assured and 27,000 policies issued (as at 31 September 2015). One of the first life insurers in Cambodia, Prudential Cambodia is committed to raising the awareness of life insurance among the Cambodian people and helping them protect and secure their financial futures.

Prudential Cambodia is part of UK-based Prudential plc. Founded in 1848, Prudential plc is an international financial services group with significant operations in Asia, the US and the UK. It serves around 25 million insurance customers and have £505 billion of assets under management (as at 30 June 2015). Prudential plc is listed on the stock exchanges in London, Hong Kong, Singapore and New York.

Prudential plc is not affiliated in any manner with Prudential Financial, Inc., a company whose principal place of business is in the United States of America.

Job Description: •	Manage the daily operations of the accounting department including:month and end-year processaccounts payable/receivablecash receiptsbudgetingcash forecastingrevenue and expenditure variance analysiscapital assets reconciliationstrust account statement reconciliationsfixed asset activitydebt activity•	Monitor and analyse accounting data and produce financial reports or statements•	Establish and enforce proper accounting methods, policies and principles•	Coordinate and complete annual audits•	Provide recommendations•	Improve systems and procedures and initiate corrective actions•	Assign projects and direct staff to ensure compliance and accuracy•	Meet financial accounting objectives•	Establish and maintain fiscal files and records to document transactions.•	Overdue accounts should be reported to SAM, FM, CFO and provide instructions as to a plan to collect the accounts•	Verify the payment status of amounts in the Accounts Payable summary. Overdue accounts, which are not paid are inquired to the Accounting Supervisor for an explanation•	Verify various reserves and amortization/ depreciation are accounted for properly per the tax laws and accounting regulations•	Check the monthly account statements, verifying all numbers, and determining, settlement deadline•	Prepare monthly cash and bank reconciliation of all outlets.•	Produce monthly reports: Monthly sale report, cash collection report to SAM, FM, CFO.•	Other tasks assigned by manage.

Job Description: Job Description Give constant direction to team members to ensure that all customer inquiries are rightfully attended to on time and in the best way possible to give them satisfaction Create better modes of operations to make customer service easier for both team members and customers Make provision for a change of mode of operation when the existing one isn’t yielding maximum results Give detailed statistical feedback on performance cue of team members to the management for staff evaluation and reward purposes Observe performance of team members to identify their strengths and weaknesses and make arrangements to strengthen their lose ends. Also, take disciplinary measures against any team members whom is found wanting Provide assistance to team members whom are experiencing difficulties in the discharge of their duties by putting them through and giving them personal coaching Ensure that all equipment and appliances needed by the customer team members are available and in good condition to enable smooth flow of operations and customer satisfactions Step in to attend to customers that are proving difficult to team members and resolve their complaints Delegate different customer service duties to team members to ensure a faster and smoother flow of operation through division of labor Create and implement work procedures that will enhance the organization and departmental service delivery, operating procedures and standardsServe as the middleman between the organization and the customer service team members to ensure smooth communication and settling of grievances that may arise in the course of work.
Job Requirement: Age from 22-40 years old Graduated bachelor Degree Showcase good leadership skills to carry team members along Excellent skills for communicating and relating with both staff members and customers Good interpersonal skills to create a cordial relationship with team members Ability to multitask Have good temperate to handle disputes and emergencies Must be result oriented Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities for the Customer Service Leader Position The skills, duties and other attributes required to excel as customer service leader Good at Computer Skill

Company Profile:
Wing Bank (Cambodia) Plc – the bank for every Cambodian – is driven by the vision to provide every Cambodian with convenient access to financial services relevant to, and for the improvement of their daily lives.

Wing Bank has revolutionized the way Cambodians access financial services by introducing instant, secure, and convenient Mobile Financial Services since 18 August 2008.

Today, Wing Bank serves the entire Cambodian population with 100% coverage of the districts in Cambodia thanks to the innovative Wing Bank App, over 10,000 Wing Cash Xpress agents, over 55,000 merchants, and partnerships with industry giants such as Mastercard, MoneyGram, AliPay, WeChat Pay, Western Union, Visa, and Ria.

Wing Bank provides an array of advanced financial products both for individual and corporate customers. These include loans, deposits, micro savings, credit referral services, money transfers, utility and insurance payments, supply chain payments, payroll services and even phone top-ups. In addition, Wing offers retail payments via “WingPay”, and has also introduced the “WingMall” e-commerce platform.

Both small and large companies alike are now using Wing’s payroll and disbursement services, speeding up their payments. Over 80% of Wing’s agents and 50% of customers are women, making Wing a shining example of gender inclusion in the region.

Wing Bank is committed to providing financial, gender and digital inclusion to the unbanked and the under-banked, allowing every Cambodian to enjoy convenience and security when it comes to financial services
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114 jobs@wingbank.com.kh No. 721, Preah Monivong Blvd., Sangkat Beung Keng Kang 3, Khan Chamkar Mon, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114

Job Description:
Main duties:

·Review and update documented procedures to ensure implementation and compliance.
·Maintain quality check records as per SOP.
·Conduct regular process audits to ensure that quality procedures be complied by manufacturing teams.
·Conduct annually internal audit as per ISO requirements.
·Maintain quality test facility and measuring equipment for product testing.
·Maintenance of plant calibration system for all QA measuring equipment. 
·Compile daily, weekly and monthly quality reports on materials, in-process and finished products.
·Coordinate plant statistical process control program and compile process capability reports (CPK)
·Other tasks assigned by the manager.
Job Requirement:
· Willing to permanently work in Sihanoukville in future.
· Quality mind-set and positive attitude.
· Fresh graduates in mechanic, electrical or other related fields or 1-2 year work experience.
·Good knowledge in ISO System, i.e. sampling theory and quality control.
·Good technical knowledge in manufacturing process.
·Good written and spoken English.
·Self-motivated team player.



*Women candidates are strongly encouraged to apply!

* Interested applicants meeting the above requirements should submit their resume with cover letter specifying the applied position to the following address not later than February-18th-2021. Applications are encouraged to apply thru below address or email.

-Email: HR-Sihanoukville@crowncork.com.sg
-Address: National Road No. 4, Phum No. 1, Sangkat No. 1, Sihanoukville.
-Tel: 034 900 119 / 081 555 822 / 081 456 737
Company Profile:
Applications are sought from customer – orientated and motivated individuals who would like a career with one of the world’s packaging leaders, CROWN Beverage Cans Sihanoukville Limited.

Part of CROWN Asia operations, we are a manufacturing plant producing aluminum beverage cans & ends in Cambodia. Job Description:
Real Estate Sales Manager Duties and Responsibilities
** Manage Sales Agents
- The most significant responsibility of real estate sales managers is keeping their agents motivated to close sales. They set weekly, monthly, and annual goals for the agents to work towards, and track these goals by meeting with agents on a regular basis. They also conduct team meetings and offer advice and incentives for agents to achieve goals.

** Hire and Train Staff
- These managers are responsible for conducting interviews and hiring real estate sales staff. They develop and implement training programs that teach sales agents how to get customers, negotiate real estate deals, acquire financing, and properly fill out sale paperwork.

** Administrative Duties
- Real estate sales managers are often responsible for administrative duties like preparing employee payroll and budget reports, marketing, and planning open houses and other events that help develop sales leads for their office. They may also order office supplies.

** Maintain Client Relationships
- Real estate sales managers maintain relationships with repeat clients to keep them satisfied and promote future business opportunities and referrals.

** Meet with Clients
- Although they don’t always act as sales agents themselves, real estate sales managers will meet with clients who need specialized attention or who are experiencing a difficult situation. They also assist sales agents who need guidance with client meetings and communication.

** Stay Informed on Real Estate Industry
- To stay current on the real estate industry, these managers spend time researching new housing regulations and legislation that affects their sales office. They also travel to attend industry meetings, seminars, and conferences to expand their industry knowledge and develop professional networks.

Real Estate Sales Manager Skills and Qualifications
- People with outgoing personalities who have a knack for motivating others to meet goals in a sales environment thrive as real estate sales managers. Employers prefers candidates who also possess the following skills:
• Coaching – helping team members reach their full sales potential is the main objective of a real estate sales manager, and the ability to support and motivate sales agents is essential to success at this job
• Salesmanship – sales skills are fundamental, as these managers must to train their sales team to build rapport, ensure client trust, and make the sale on a regular basis
• Team management – it is the responsibility of the real estate sales manager to oversee the sales agent team and handle any issues that arise, as well as to make sure sales goals are met
• Communication skills – the ability to listen to and speak with clients, sales agents, and other managers is essential for effective real estate sales managers
• Business acumen – an understanding of how a business achieves objectives and goals to drive sales is important for real estate sales managers. They must think strategically, understand the real estate industry, and have a manager mindset
• Performance management – these managers must plan and implement sales objects and evaluate sales performance to ensure goal accomplishment
Job Requirement:
** Real Estate Sales Manager Education and Training
- Real estate sales managers need a four-year college degree in real estate, business administration, or finance. They also must possess a qualified real estate license in the state where they wish to work. Acquiring a real estate agent license usually involves completing a 30- to 90-hour certification course and passing a written test. After a sales agent becomes experienced, they are eligible to be promoted to sales manager. Most employers seek candidates with advanced skills in selling and negotiation.

** Experience: Sale and Operation Manager in Real Estate, 2-5 years. 
** Salary range: $800-$1500

Job Description:
- Lead all procurement and logistic activities of the company for the on-going projects, in line with the standard of procedures for the procurement department.
- Lead all procurement activities, suppliers’ requests for quotation and sub-contractors bid package for tender projects, in line the company strategy and culture for the implication of suppliers and subcontractors, and in compliance with the standards of procedure for the tender projects.
- Assist the architect, tender and engineering team for the preparation of tender proposal, preparation and submission of sub-contractors bid packages, lead the subcontractors post-tender clarifications, ensure compliance of the sub-contractors submissions with the project budget, timeline and technical constraints. 
- Prepare and communicate the procurement schedule for on-going projects, integrate the procurement conditions into the project programme of works.
- Investigate, analyse and communicate specific procurement / delivery conditions allowing better compliance with the project construction schedule.
- Negotiate terms and conditions of the subcontracted works, prepare and execute the subcontract agreements. Collect and treat the subcontractors claims, variation orders, progress payment certificates as well as all the subcontractors commercial and contractual submissions.
- Place orders, ensure on-time deliveries, control the quality of the deliveries and manage the suppliers and subcontractors after-sales claims.
- Manage the construction budgets for material for the on-going projects. Prepare and communicate cost monitoring reports, cost comparison forms and suppliers and subcontractor’s performance assessment forms.
- Assist the project management teams for the identification of critical works, anticipate related issues and propose and implement solutions to overcome such issues. Initiate efficient and time-wise communication with the client and submission of notices and claims to ensure best-value is obtained for such specific situations.
- Assist the project management teams for the good and efficient execution of the works onsite, monitoring of the subcontractor’s progress.
Skills
- Establish course of action to accomplish goals, develop schedule and lead multiple activities at once by effectively utilizing available resources.
- Ability to read and combine construction drawings, diagrams and specifications. Ability to provide technical expertise on materials and construction methods.
- Full knowledge of project management tools and documentation specific to construction projects and construction delivery methods. Familiarity with construction contracts general clauses and specific terms and conditions (both for build only and design and build contracts).
- Excellent written and verbal communications skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to effectively present information. Ability to build key relationships across all stakeholders of the projects, as well as with recurrent partners.
Job Requirement:
- Education: Bachelor Degree and/or Master Degree in Business administration, project management and entrepreneurship or procurement and supply chain management and related fields.
- At least 7 years of experience in procurement/supply chain management. 
- Relevant experience in construction sector will be a major asset for your application.
- Proficient in Microsoft office suite, Excel, Microsoft Project, and other Enterprise Resources Planning computerized system.
- Ability to understand and complete all work-related documentation accurately and on time.
- Ability to work to deadlines.
- Good communication, organizational and interpersonal skills.
Company Profile:
From 1991 to this day, we remain one of the few companies still in operation in Cambodia. LBL finds itself at the high-end of the construction market in the country. We specialize in the implementation and realization of prestigious projects such as luxury hotels, exclusive villas, embassies, offices and residential buildings. As a leader in this domain with a reputation for quality and professionalism.

www.lbl-group.com

Company Profile: AIA Cambodia is guided by our Purpose to help Cambodians live Healthier, Longer, Better lives. Since commencing business in 2017, we’ve become the first life insurer to provide coverage on 26 critical illnesses. As among the Kingdom’s leading insurers, AIA Cambodia today offers market-leading life solutions for all walks of life ranging from tailor-made crucial coverage plans that include critical illnesses, accidents, hospital allowances and overseas emergency assistance.AIA Cambodia has strived to make a significant, positive impact for our customers and communities. As we look to the future, this commitment is reinforced by our Purpose: to help millions of people live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives. Our Purpose guides the decisions we make and the actions we take as an organization — empowering and enabling people to understand and manage their health, while meeting their long-term savings and protection needs. Helping create a healthier Asia is one of the most important and valuable things we can do for our communities, today and tomorrow.AIA Cambodia is the only Cambodian life insurer awarded HR Asia’s “Best Companies to Work for in Asia” for three consecutive years, in 2020, 2021 and 2022. Headquartered in Phnom Penh, the company currently has branches in Siem Reap, Kampot, Kampong Cham and Battambang.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   070 949 111 kh.careers@aia.com  12th Floor, Exchange Square, Street 106-61  ,Sangkat Wat Phnom, Khan Daun Penh, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 070 949 111

Company Profile:
Wing Bank (Cambodia) Plc – the bank for every Cambodian – is driven by the vision to provide every Cambodian with convenient access to financial services relevant to, and for the improvement of their daily lives.

Wing Bank has revolutionized the way Cambodians access financial services by introducing instant, secure, and convenient Mobile Financial Services since 18 August 2008.

Today, Wing Bank serves the entire Cambodian population with 100% coverage of the districts in Cambodia thanks to the innovative Wing Bank App, over 10,000 Wing Cash Xpress agents, over 55,000 merchants, and partnerships with industry giants such as Mastercard, MoneyGram, AliPay, WeChat Pay, Western Union, Visa, and Ria.

Wing Bank provides an array of advanced financial products both for individual and corporate customers. These include loans, deposits, micro savings, credit referral services, money transfers, utility and insurance payments, supply chain payments, payroll services and even phone top-ups. In addition, Wing offers retail payments via “WingPay”, and has also introduced the “WingMall” e-commerce platform.

Both small and large companies alike are now using Wing’s payroll and disbursement services, speeding up their payments. Over 80% of Wing’s agents and 50% of customers are women, making Wing a shining example of gender inclusion in the region.

Wing Bank is committed to providing financial, gender and digital inclusion to the unbanked and the under-banked, allowing every Cambodian to enjoy convenience and security when it comes to financial services

Company Profile:
At DKSH, our purpose is to enrich people’s lives by providing access to goods, services and insights. United by our vision to be the trusted partner, we help companies grow in Asia and beyond across our Business Units Healthcare, Consumer Goods, Performance Materials and Technology.

Delivering life-saving drugs to hospitals, bringing high-quality products to remote villages, installing technology that raises living standards and providing new formulations for healthcare products that make life easier. These are just a few examples of how DKSH touches people’s lives around the clock. We do this while helping our clients and customers grow by providing services including sourcing, market insights, marketing and sales, eCommerce, distribution and logistics as well as after-sales services.

Listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange, DKSH operates in 36 markets with 32,450 specialists, generating net sales of CHF 10.7 billion in 2020. Founded by Swiss entrepreneurs in 1865, we have been deeply root

job title: Supervisor - Sales Admin, Contract Management & Claim
position: Supervisor - Sales Admin, Contract Management & Claim
Job Description: • To be in charge of assessing Track, Monitor, and Review all the Sales related Contracts and Claims, and report monthly, supporting and ensuring all the Contract Sponsorship, Incentives, and all kind of Sales related incentives are operating in an Effective and Efficient manner.• To carry out the assessment and analysis for all contract proposals propose by the Sales Teams, provide the comments to highlight the risks and opportunities to align with the approved SOP.• To assist Sales Admin Manager in drafting and setting the Standard Operation Procedure (SOP) for all the Sales Related Contracts, Sponsorship and Claims processes, review, and feedback with the SOP Adherence from time to time basis.• To support the Sales planning & forecasting by providing the Data and Reports to assist on the Sales Planning processes.• To track and update with the progress of sales commitments/targets and orders status to Sales Teams and customers.• To review all the Sales Related contracts and provides the Monthly and Quarterly Reviews to the Sales Teams and management. • To check and review all the Sales related sponsorships and claims, prepare a Payment Proposal according to the level of approval to aligned with the Chart of Authority (COA) standard.• To collaborate with Finance, Credit Control, and Sales Region on Customer’s credit status (Statement) before every sponsorship or Claims payout.• Compiling all the necessary documents, claims, and reports from all the Regions.• To ensure a Proper Filling System to keep all the Sales Related Contracts, SOPs, Claims, and all the supporting documents.   • People Development • Learn to Improve Behavior• Identify and propose training for self and team members for improvements.

Job Description:
 Provide skilled health assessment, diagnosis and treatment services to patients
 Order diagnostic tests as needed, check and follow up the results in a timely manner
 Administer and prescribe treatment and drugs effectively
 Refer patients appropriately, in consultation with Supervisor, to other healthcare providers if their
needs exceed the range of care the Clinic can provide
 Consult, collaborate and work constructively and harmoniously with colleagues to provide optimal care
 Document all care provided and education or information given to patients within their medical health
record, as per professional and practice standards
 Participate in annual performance appraisal and set work and personal goals for the upcoming year
 Maintain a working knowledge of legislation that affects medical practices
 Provide services courteously and respectfully with regard to the cultural beliefs and needs of patients
 Respond openly to complaints or feedback
 Declare vested interests in services that you may be referring to
 Demonstrate a working knowledge of company policy with regard to clinic practices as described in Standard Operating Procedures and Policies
 Report incidents as required
 Protect and maintain the confidentiality of medical information or records of patients

** Required Skills and Knowledge
 Medical Skill
 English Communication
 Computer: Word, Excel
 Customer centric.
 Customer Service Mindset
 Excellent Interpersonal Skill

 Strong interpersonal communication

 Ability to use computerized patient management systems
 Ability to keep a cool head in emergency situations

 At least 5 years’ experience as an an obstetrician and gynecologist
 Experience working in a multinational working environment
Required Qualifications
 Registration or license as an Obstetrician and Gynecologist

Company Profile:
Raffles Medical Cambodia was opened in 1992 and is renowned for the delivery of comprehensive international standards of medical services. The staff consists of well qualified doctors and nurses who are familiar with the health dynamics in Cambodia, and are able to provide full support for expatriates, residents and tourists for day to day health management, vaccinations, medical stabilization and treatment in the event of a medical emergency.

Patients will receive the same high level of service and renowned quality of care, with continued access to our panel of international and local doctors. Patients and onshore panel of doctors can also expect to benefit from access to the clinical expertise and support from the Raffles specialists in Singapore.

Job Description:
• Provide the highest possible level of nursing care to all patients consistent with international standards
• Take and monitor vital signs of patients and check for any irregularities in their conditions
• Prioritize health problems and intervene appropriately to assist the patient in complex, urgent or emergency
situations, including initiation of effective emergency care
• Maintain and process patients’ records and report patients’ conditions to doctors/physicians
• Help patients to get ready for tests and other examinations
• Plan and implement patient care program
• Clean wounds and cuts
• Advise, support and, where appropriate, administer vaccinations for patients
• Attend various meetings, workshops, and training as required to maintain updated on skills and knowledge of best
nursing practices
• Participate and contribute to the development of nursing policies and procedures
• Utilize and demonstrate sensitive communication styles, to ensure patients are fully informed and consent to
treatment
• Communicate effectively with patients and caregivers, recognizing the need for alternative methods of
communication to overcome different levels of understanding, cultural background and preferred ways.
Job Requirement:
• Strong understanding of nursing process.
• Strong understanding of emergency protocols and nursing actions during an emergency
• Attention to details and problem solving approach.
• Customer focused with good customer-handling skills.
• Ability to interact with various cultures and all levels in a multinational environment.
• Ability to analyze / solve problems in a fast paced environment.
• Multi tasking capabilities to accommodate a multi-unit organization.
• Able to demonstrate a professional manner at all times
• Able to demonstrate friendly. tactful attitude and empathy to patients.
• Physically, emotionally, and mentally fit
• Interpersonal and communication skills and teamwork
• Problem solving
• At least one year's experience working as a nurse preferable in a high dependency or emergency area.
• Nursing Diploma or Bachelor Degree or country equivalent
• Able to communicate in English

Job Description:
•Welcome guests and visitors to the front lobby of the facility, record their information and choose a room or rooms for them based on their needs.
•Coordinate solutions quickly when guests experience problems in their room by working with housekeeping and/or service staff.
•Collect the guest’s payment using either credit/debits cards, cash or checking account information for rooms at the end of each stay and ask for a room deposit when necessary.
•Settle the facility register at the end of each shift or day by counting the drawer, printing receipts and running financial activity reports.
•Ensure that extra services ordered by the guests, such as alcoholic drinks, entertainment and food, are properly accounted for and charged on the final bill.
•Communicate with other hotel staff, such as housekeeping or maintenance, when rooms are ready to be cleaned or repaired in preparation for a new guest.
•Keep the hotel lobby area inviting and clean by vacuuming, dusting, setting up welcome supplies and other various duties.
Job Requirement:
•Graduated from high school, college graduation is preferred
•Computer knowledge：Microsoft Word，Excel，PowerPoint
•Able to speak Mandarin，English and Khmer.
•Ability to handle customer complaints.
•Comply with company attendance and department policy.
•Good work Responsibility

We are now seeking candidates looking to advance and grow their careers in our dynamic and exciting operation and gain hands-on experience in a thriving and supportive workplace.

Job Description:
 Dispense medicines, drugs, and vaccines as required in accordance with agreed procedures and guidelines
 Develop and implement all necessary procedures and guidelines to ensure the effective dispensing
and control of drugs, medicines, and vaccines and monitor these to ensure that they are kept up to date
 Give professional pharmaceutical advice to medical and professional staff and customers
 Control inventory and purchase or order drugs, medicines, vaccines and disposables and ensure that
they are available at all times
 Maintain all required records relating to the issues of drugs, medicines, and vaccines and ensure that these are kept confidential
 Keep track on the expiry dates of drugs, medicines, and vaccines and come up with reports accordingly
 Maintain pharmacy CMS inventory
 Perform stock count in cooperation with officers from Finance
 Take all necessary steps to ensure that drugs, medicines, and vaccines are stored securely and in the
right conditions
 Develop and maintain all necessary procedures and controls to ensure that statutory requirements are
complied with
 Maintain up-to-date knowledge of drugs, medicines, and vaccines and pharmacy practice to ensure
that services provided are of the highest standard
 Observe all requirements to maintain a safe and healthy working environment
 Ensure the compliance with General Affairs, Policies, and Procedures (GAPP)
 Maintain and build good relationship with suppliers
 Complete other tasks assigned by the Line Manager / Supervisor
Job Requirement:
 Required Skills and Knowledge
 Ability to work within a multi-disciplinary team
 Very good customer services skills
 Very good interpersonal skills
 Very good presentation and communication skills

Required Competencies
 Able to work under pressure and deliver results timeously
 Have a positive working attitude and good interpersonal skills
 Be able to align employees for success
Required Work Experience
 At least 3 years’ experience of working in a pharmacy
 Experience of drug monitoring
 Experience of patient counseling
Required Qualifications
 A degree in pharmacy

Required Languages
 English and Khmer

Job Description: •	Maintain monitoring processes and information systems to ensure all training and supervision systems are in place. •	Work together with colleagues to take responsibility for the development and deployment of an effective, skilled and competent team of staff. •	Identify, develop, implement, manage and coordinate the development of all programs to enhance profitability and reduce costs. •	Handle VIP guests from all over the world, mainly from Asia regions (China, Japan & Korea, etc).•	Define long-term organizational strategic goals, builds key customer relationships. •	Identify business opportunities, negotiates and closes business deals and maintain extensive knowledge of current market conditions. •	Work with the internal team, marketing staff, and other managers to increase sales opportunities and thereby maximize revenue for their organization. •	Find potential new customers, ultimately convert them into clients by contacting and entertaining them, promote and sell the attributes of the facilities and areas to ensure future business growth in the future. •	Manage existing clients and handle special needs of clients and ensure they stay satisfied and positive. •	Assisting the Senior Manager in daily administrative and management duties of the department. •	Foster creations of customer development culture throughout the casino through strategic efforts and teamwork. •	Evaluate customer segmentation models for growth opportunities in trips, customer win, and customer acquisition by segment or gaming preference. •	Assists in planning and implementation of future projects in Casino Marketing. •	Assist on gaming floor services including exchanging casino chips and greeting guests •	Assist to increase the amount of new membership and maintain a good relationship with all guests.•	Interact with department and team members, management, and contractors professionally and positively. •	Encourage good relationships, promote team spirit, and ensure effective two-way and multicultural communications. •	Adhere to the company policies and procedures and comply with the Code of Conduct. •	Perform other related duties as assigned.
Job Requirement: •	Proven ability to work remotely and independently. •	Must have a minimum of 3 years’ customer service and casino marketing experience. •	Previous marketing management experience is highly preferred. •	Bachelor’s degree or equivalent qualifications.•	Proficiency in MS Office. •	Must be able to work on flexible shifts including overnight, weekends and holidays on rotation basis. •	Must be able to sit or stand for long periods of time. •	Ability to speak and write in Asian languages (either Chinese, Korea and/or Japanese) preferred.•	Self-motivated, well-organized, responsible, friendly and polite with excellent communication and interpersonal skills•	Team player who responds quickly to demands and thrives in a high-pressure work environment.•	Able to multi-task.

Company Profile:
Wing Bank (Cambodia) Plc – the bank for every Cambodian – is driven by the vision to provide every Cambodian with convenient access to financial services relevant to, and for the improvement of their daily lives.

Wing Bank has revolutionized the way Cambodians access financial services by introducing instant, secure, and convenient Mobile Financial Services since 18 August 2008.

Today, Wing Bank serves the entire Cambodian population with 100% coverage of the districts in Cambodia thanks to the innovative Wing Bank App, over 10,000 Wing Cash Xpress agents, over 55,000 merchants, and partnerships with industry giants such as Mastercard, MoneyGram, AliPay, WeChat Pay, Western Union, Visa, and Ria.

Wing Bank provides an array of advanced financial products both for individual and corporate customers. These include loans, deposits, micro savings, credit referral services, money transfers, utility and insurance payments, supply chain payments, payroll services and even phone top-ups. In addition, Wing offers retail payments via “WingPay”, and has also introduced the “WingMall” e-commerce platform.

Both small and large companies alike are now using Wing’s payroll and disbursement services, speeding up their payments. Over 80% of Wing’s agents and 50% of customers are women, making Wing a shining example of gender inclusion in the region.

Wing Bank is committed to providing financial, gender and digital inclusion to the unbanked and the under-banked, allowing every Cambodian to enjoy convenience and security when it comes to financial services
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114 jobs@wingbank.com.kh No. 721, Preah Monivong Blvd., Sangkat Beung Keng Kang 3, Khan Chamkar Mon, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 078 988 290 / 078 989 509 / 078 989 114

•Provide oversight and management to the IT Business Application team to deliver IT services
•Assesses user needs to provide support and proactive service, including analysis of opportunities in order to take advantage of available tools
•Acts as a focal point for communicating related system problems within the department and collaborates with other teams and vendors on changes, fixes, and updates
•Manages the release process for applications which includes effective department wide and end user communication
•Manages testing scripts and identifies opportunities for improvement
•Sets and measures performance objectives and provides regular one-on-one feedback to all members of the team.
•Addresses individual staff performance problems as needed
•Manages delivery and SLAS by guiding incident resolution, problem management, maintenance, and enhancement tickets raised by the end users for assigned applications 
•Develops relevant metrics, measures and publishes the performance of the services provided and enables continuous improvement activities in collaboration with peer groups 
•Works closely with all other IT management personnel in identifying, evaluating, selecting, and implementing specific information technologies that support the business plans and IT strategies 
•Ensure department adheres to policies and procedures that are compliant with industry and regulatory policies 
•Assists with the preparation of budget for IT systems and services related interfaces and applications 
•Keeps abreast of new developments and forecasts future trends in the area of application integration in the casino industry 
•Maintains a strong understanding of technology and its application to achieve business objectives 
•Prepares analysis and or proposals for other enterprise departments when necessary 
•Serves as an internal consultant to other IT management staff and operations community as needed 
•Develop and maintain an effective on-call rotation for 24/7 support 
•Provides ongoing troubleshooting, support, and maintenance of applications, including 24/7 on call coverage as required
Job Requirement:
•University degree or college in related technology filed 7-10 years for Business Applications Manager in relevant work management experience in applications support & Database role. 
•Strong knowledge of business application development in C#.net with SQL Server, testing, preferably in the Casino field. 
•Experience in a variety of data integration technologies - ETL, flat files, XML, SOAP, etc. 
• Knowledge and understanding of goals and the interdependencies of functional departments and groups (in Casino industry) and the ability to lead large-scale complex IT projects in addressing overall business needs. 
•Advanced knowledge of PHP Laravel or any PHP Framework 
•JavaScript framework in Angular JS or other frameworks 
•Advanced functionally In Database MySQL, SQL Server, Mongoose DB, Postgres 
•Advanced knowledge in API or Web-service 
•Advanced knowledge In UI Design jQuery, Ajax, HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap 
•Knowledge in any framework for building real- time WebSocket or any framework 
•Good at System Development Life Cycle, requirement gathering and analysis 
•Casino Management Systems, Hotel Management Systems, SAP, Point of Sale 
•Software development, Web Development, Database architecture 
•Knowledge and ability to direct a staff in integrating information technology services with the work requirements and deliverables of the unit 
•Knowledge of information technology disciplines; e.g., software applications and interfaces, production operations, quality assurance and systems management, etc. 
•Chinese and English preferred/ other languages are advantages

Company Profile: AIA Cambodia is guided by our Purpose to help Cambodians live Healthier, Longer, Better lives. Since commencing business in 2017, we’ve become the first life insurer to provide coverage on 26 critical illnesses. As among the Kingdom’s leading insurers, AIA Cambodia today offers market-leading life solutions for all walks of life ranging from tailor-made crucial coverage plans that include critical illnesses, accidents, hospital allowances and overseas emergency assistance.AIA Cambodia has strived to make a significant, positive impact for our customers and communities. As we look to the future, this commitment is reinforced by our Purpose: to help millions of people live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives. Our Purpose guides the decisions we make and the actions we take as an organization — empowering and enabling people to understand and manage their health, while meeting their long-term savings and protection needs. Helping create a healthier Asia is one of the most important and valuable things we can do for our communities, today and tomorrow.AIA Cambodia is the only Cambodian life insurer awarded HR Asia’s “Best Companies to Work for in Asia” for three consecutive years, in 2020, 2021 and 2022. Headquartered in Phnom Penh, the company currently has branches in Siem Reap, Kampot, Kampong Cham and Battambang.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   070 949 111 kh.careers@aia.com  12th Floor, Exchange Square, Street 106-61  ,Sangkat Wat Phnom, Khan Daun Penh, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 070 949 111

As among the Kingdom’s leading insurers, AIA Cambodia today offers market-leading life solutions for all walks of life ranging from tailor-made crucial coverage plans that include critical illnesses, accidents, hospital allowances and overseas emergency assistance.AIA Cambodia has strived to make a significant, positive impact for our customers and communities. As we look to the future, this commitment is reinforced by our Purpose: to help millions of people live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives. Our Purpose guides the decisions we make and the actions we take as an organization — empowering and enabling people to understand and manage their health, while meeting their long-term savings and protection needs. Helping create a healthier Asia is one of the most important and valuable things we can do for our communities, today and tomorrow.AIA Cambodia is the only Cambodian life insurer awarded HR Asia’s “Best Companies to Work for in Asia” for three consecutive years, in 2020, 2021 and 2022. Headquartered in Phnom Penh, the company currently has branches in Siem Reap, Kampot, Kampong Cham and Battambang.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   070 949 111 kh.careers@aia.com  12th Floor, Exchange Square, Street 106-61  ,Sangkat Wat Phnom, Khan Daun Penh, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 070 949 111

Job Description:
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
-Ensuring the activities of the Rabies Prevention Center according to the leadership of the head of the IPC Vaccination Center.
-Providing the consultation/prescription of Rabies Post-Exposure Prophylaxis protocol (PEP) to clients according to Standard Operation Procedures of Vaccination Center.
-Contributing to rabies clinical research projects.
-Providing the scientific advice related to rabies PEP via phone call, email, and Facebook page 
-Maintaining the database of patient clinical information and rabies PEP prescription 
(Includes data entry and management of the data)
-Maintaining the cold chain for storage of vaccines and immunoglobulins
-Managing the stock-inventory of the Rabies Prevention Center
-Generating the regular weekly and monthly activity reports 
-Closely interacting with management and laboratory team at IPC
-Managing the animal specimen and laboratory result (specimen reception, shipment, and test results) 
-Ensuring the necessary opening of the center during certain public holidays for the benefit of patients
-Respecting the work timing and IPC internal rules
Job Requirement: RECRUITMENT CONDITIONS: -Cambodian nationality -Language skill required: English and/or French in addition to Khmer-Willing to work based at Kampong Cham provinceStarting date: March 15th, 2021QUALIFICATIONS:-Strong leadership and team management-Experiences in outpatient consultation and vaccination -Willing to work in prevention of rabies-Newly graduated medical doctors are also encouraged for application-High spirit of ethics, responsibility and professionalism -Proficiency in Khmer and English and/or French-Good team work, Good in communication, meticulous, autonomous-Good availability to ensure necessary opening of the rabies prevention center  -Computer literacy: Word, Excel, Stata, RedcapThe complete application includes a cover letter – with salary expectations, copies of diplomas if any, work certificates, curriculum vitae with a recent photo, Identity Card photocopy - all certified documents to the originals – are to be sent to the Human Resources department of Institut Pasteur du Cambodge #5, Monivong Blvd, Phnom Penh or by email to: recrutement@pasteur-kh.org, phone number: 092 777 665.Deadline: February 21st, 2021
Company Profile: The Institut Pasteur du Cambodge (IPC) is a Cambodian non-for-profit research institution established in 1953, IPC is today a scientific research establishment declared of public utility placed under the high patronage of the Ministry of Health of the Kingdom of Cambodia and under the responsibility of the Institute Pasteur on the scientific and technical levels. The IPC is a member of the Pasteur Network, which brings together 33 institutes present on five continents. It shares the Pasteurian values and the ethical charter to which the Pasteur Institutes are bound. The IPC has more than 250 employees, including about 30 expatriates of 10 nationalities and includes 5 research units. It carries out research activities in health biology, public health and service activities (Medical Biology Laboratory, vaccinations and water and food analyses) and training.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department  092 777 665 recrutement@pasteur-kh.org, #5, Monivong Blvd, Phnom Penh. 092 777 665

Job Description:
1. Job Description
The Sales & Marketing Officer works closely with the General Manager and the Chief Operating Officer based in Bangkok to develop target income goals. Goal-oriented and driven, the Sales & Marketing Officer must create a sales plan that meets specific benchmarks and offers room for growth. He/she acts as a liaison between customer and factory. Using his/her extensive customer network, the Sales & Marketing Officer will provide complete and appropriate solutions for every customer in order to boost top-line revenue growth, customer acquisition levels and profitability.

** Your main missions are:
- Present, promote and sell rice using solid arguments to existing and prospective customers
- Develop the company's activity internationally, including being active on social media (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn…)
- Find new target markets and penetrates them to drive sales
- Achieve agreed upon sales targets and outcomes within schedule
- Manage the sales network, track sales and status report
- Plan advertising and promotional campaigns for products or services on a variety of media (social, print etc.)
- Conduct market research to identify opportunities for promotion and growth
- Expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to ensure a high level of client satisfactions.
- Maintain healthy receivables & monitor level of bad debts
- Work Closely with other departments of the company
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor Degree in Sales & Marketing Management field or related.
- Proven work experience as a Sales & Marketing Officer (at least 3 years)
- Familiarity with BRM and CRM practices along with ability to build productive business professional relationships
- Highly motivated and target driven with a proven track record in sales
- Excellent selling, communication and negotiation skills
- Prioritizing, time management and organizational skills
- Ability to create and deliver presentations tailored to the audience needs
- Good understanding of market research techniques, statistical and data analysis methods
- Thorough understanding of social media and web analytics
- Relationship management skills and openness to feedback
- Fluency in English and Khmer is required
- Professionalism, honesty, integrity and teamwork


- Salary: 600 to 900 $
- Please send CV and letter to: contact@fedrice.com
Company Profile: Since 2013, the Duval Group has specialized in food products. The Group imports Asian products into the French ethnic market and has positioned itself as one of the main players in its sector. Duval Group owns a rice factory in Cambodia and export to different markets its rice, including jasmine long grain rice harvested and processed in Cambodia (named best rice producer country in 2018). The group is also in the business of organic and fair-trade rice.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   contact@fedrice.com #148EA2, St. 430, Tuol Tompoung 2, Phnom Penh.

Company Profile:
Cambodia Beverage Company Ltd (CBC) referred too locally as Coca-Cola Cambodia is a leading manufacturer & distributor of non-alcoholic ready to drink (NARTD) beverages throughout Cambodia. With our state-of-the-art bottling plant (commissioned in 2016) situated within PPSEZ, one of the leading Economic Zones in Phnom Penh.

The company produces 16 different beverages, under 8 brands, and within 5 different NARTD categories (Sparkling, Tea, Energy, Water, and Isotonic) which is supplied to our customers throughout the Kingdom.
CBC directly employs more than 850 staff while creating indirect employment opportunities for another 8,000+ staff across the Kingdom.

We are proud that >99.7% of our workforce are Cambodian nationals and that >31% of our staff are female, with women making up 37% of the senior management team. We are committed to increasing our female diversity and are targeting to have 50% female staff by 2030.
We are committed to integrating sustainability into everything we do.

By 2030 we aim to collect and recycle a bottle or can for each one we sell by 2030 and use at least 50% recycled material in our packaging.
We are committed to return to nature and communities 100%+ of the water we use in our drinks and their production. We are working to increase water security where we operate, source ingredients, and touch people's lives.

Company Profile:
The A.P. Moller – Maersk Group was founded in 1904 in Denmark. Since then, the Group has grown into the largest shipping & logistics provider in the world. It has more than 300 offices and representations in over 100 countries worldwide employing more than 76,000 people. The activities, apart from shipping and logistics, include industry, retail, shipbuilding as well as oil & gas exploration.

Maersk Cambodia, its affiliated company, has been supporting the Cambodian trade since 1992, being one of the first international container shipping companies to serve the Cambodian market. It remains one of the largest container shipping lines operating in Cambodia today.

Job Description:
The role of Customer Service Executive is to own/manage the customer experience of his/her customers. This includes proactively monitoring and managing the end-to-end shipment process in compliance with all company procedures, ensuring that the cargo is transported as per the transport plan promised to the customer and/or that the customers is kept informed of relevant deviations. Building relationships with the customers, understanding their business drivers should be leveraged to continuously improve cooperation and process to the mutual benefit of the customer and Sealand.

Key Responsibilities:
• Be the primary point of contact for own customers and act as an advocate for the Customers, internally within Sealand
• Actively build strong relationships with customers and gain an understanding of their business, service needs, drivers and desires
• Ensure smooth execution of the end-to-end shipment lifecycle, by working closely with the customer as well as internal stakeholders
• Proactively track shipments and notify customers of relevant deviations from the transport plan, including potential solutions or alternatives
• Be the owner of all customer issues and engage relevant stakeholders as required to facilitate timely and effective solutions
• Manage / improve day to day process interaction with own customers by leveraging detailed customer knowledge
• Be fully responsible for customer satisfaction (own customers)
• Understand claims policy and its impact on company assets and guide customers best possible through any potential claim situation
• Commercial intelligence:  In-depth knowledge about the industries in which his/her customers operate
• In general, actively seek out and act on continuous improvement opportunities both in relation to customers and internal / external stakeholders
• Always behave in a manner consistent with and loyal to the company values
Job Requirement:
Key Requirements:
• Strong interest in logistics and supply chain industry.
• Junior or Senior in college or recent graduate with BA/BS in Economics or related field.
• Good at English and communication skills.
• Strong Microsoft Outlook and Office Suite Skills.
• Ability to work well independently and in a team-oriented environment.
• Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and work in a fast-paced environment.

Benefit and Working hour:
• Competitive salary. 
• Training and career development. 
• Working conditions follow Cambodia labor law. 
• Mon - Fri: 8 AM - 5:30 PM (1 hour and a half lunch break). 
• Sat morning: 8 AM - 12 PM.

Company Profile:
Prudential (Cambodia) Life Assurance PLC began operations in Cambodia in January 2013. It is the leading life insurer in Cambodia with more than USD280 million assured and 27,000 policies issued (as at 31 September 2015). One of the first life insurers in Cambodia, Prudential Cambodia is committed to raising the awareness of life insurance among the Cambodian people and helping them protect and secure their financial futures.

Prudential Cambodia is part of UK-based Prudential plc. Founded in 1848, Prudential plc is an international financial services group with significant operations in Asia, the US and the UK. It serves around 25 million insurance customers and have £505 billion of assets under management (as at 30 June 2015). Prudential plc is listed on the stock exchanges in London, Hong Kong, Singapore and New York.

Prudential plc is not affiliated in any manner with Prudential Financial, Inc., a company whose principal place of business is in the United States of America.

Job Description:
-	Collaborate with business subject matter experts to elicit requirements and assist them in writing user story and defining acceptance criteria.  
-	Provide technical solutions consultancy, efficient process flow and user experience design, and innovative solution with automation and AI capabilities.
-	Analyze the impact and benefit to assist business owners make an informed decision in delivering key strategic projects. 
-	Validate both process and system solution implementation to ensure alignment between development and solution.
-	Coordinate software development process from end-to-end in agile environment including system integration testing, API testing, UAT, and release management. 
-	Collaborate with cross functions (Agile delivery, Product, Data Science, Architecture, Infrastructure, etc.) to ensure alignment and moving in the right direction.
-	Identify gaps, issues, risks then propose technical solutions for mitigation.
-	Document technical artifacts, solutions, defects, knowledge base, and relevant project deliverables in agile tools such as Jira/Azure DevOps, Confluence, and Bitbucket.
-	Create, review, and analyze complex integrated data models and information from various sources (ERP, CRM, and unstructured data, etc.)
-	Develop reports, dashboards, metrics using various technology and query languages such as SQL Query, PowerBI, Azure SQL PaaS Database, CouchBase DB, and API.
-	Present complex business and technical requirements and/or information that is appropriately tailored to the target audience.
Job Requirement:
•	Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information System Management, or related technical discipline.  
•	Minimum 2 years’ experience in business analyst, system analyst, and software engineer in insurance, banking, or similar environment. 
•	Experience in object-oriented programming language like C#, Java, or Python.
•	Experience in working with Microsoft SQL Server, DB2, PostgreSQL, Microsoft Azure SQL PaaS DB, PowerBI, and API.
•	In-depth understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC), Agile methodologies (DevOps or Scrum).
•	Knowledge of software development tools such as Azure DevOps, Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, or similar tools. 
•	Understand solution architecture and all infrastructure components required for application/software development.
•	Ability to work with a globally distributed cross functional team from multiple disciplines with fast pace parallel agile project delivery.
•	Ability to create professional business and technical documentation.
•	Good at listening skills, teamwork, demonstrating intellectual curiosity, innovative thinking, and adaptive to changes.
•	Good level of English in both written and spoken communication.
Company Profile:
Prudential (Cambodia) Life Assurance PLC began operations in Cambodia in January 2013. It is the leading life insurer in Cambodia with more than USD280 million assured and 27,000 policies issued (as at 31 September 2015). One of the first life insurers in Cambodia, Prudential Cambodia is committed to raising the awareness of life insurance among the Cambodian people and helping them protect and secure their financial futures.

Prudential Cambodia is part of UK-based Prudential plc. Founded in 1848, Prudential plc is an international financial services group with significant operations in Asia, the US and the UK. It serves around 25 million insurance customers and have £505 billion of assets under management (as at 30 June 2015). Prudential plc is listed on the stock exchanges in London, Hong Kong, Singapore and New York.

Prudential plc is not affiliated in any manner with Prudential Financial, Inc., a company whose principal place of business is in the United States of America.
